description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Hyper-V remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-30017):

1. Apply the relevant KB updates based on your system's version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: Apply KB5037771
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: Apply KB5037771
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: Apply KB5037770
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: Apply KB5037768
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: Apply KB5037768
   - For Windows 10: Apply KB5037788

2. Restart your system after installing the updates to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- These updates address a heap-based buffer overflow that could allow remote code execution. Ensure you verify the build number before proceeding with the installation. 
- Download the updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
  - [KB5037788](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037788)
  - [KB5037770](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037770)
  - [KB5037768](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768)
  - [KB5037771](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running the corresponding Windows version.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
